manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Build your own garden! Build a flower garden playset contains assorted types of flowers, stem, and leaves which are brightly colored Lovely Gift for Kids Perfect for sending it as a gift in all festival e.g Christmas, birthday. Qualified Toys Designed to be visually pleasing and help children with flower parts recognition and color recognition.
Package Included - 46 pieces of flower components - 1 cute kettle - Gift box with instruction

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Lovely toy set! GREAT value for money!
reviews.reviewText: I am OBSESSED with this toy set. I work with kids with autism, and I am always looking for good assembly-type toys to work on motor skills and play skills and creativity, and this is by far my new favorite set. My clients love it too!! There are TONS of pieces , and they are all different, so there are practically infinite combinations! It's new every time it's used! They seem like decent quality as well, and like they will last a while, even with heavy use. I have two minor complaints: 1) some of the pieces (not all of them, only some, which is weird) don't "nest" very tightly, so they're really loose and fall out easily. 2) it would be nice if there were a few more of the "base" pieces, or if they were longer with the holes farther apart, so there would be more places to "plant" the flowers. Neither of these things are annoying enough to remove a star though - just minor complaints / feedback for purchase future improvements.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Let the good times bloom!
reviews.reviewText: I bought these for me and my granddaughter who is almost three. She will play with them when I get them out but they are not a toy she asks for. I keep her toys put up and only bring certain ones out one at a time so she doesn't grow bored with anything she has. She is also pretty little so I'm hoping this set is something she will play with for many years to come. They really are pretty and a lot of fun to play with so I'm thinking in a few years she will really enjoy them!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Durable and Fun

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I like that there are so many different flower shapes & sizes and they all fit together. My granddaughter had no problem putting these together. Just wish they “clicked” together as they fall apart pretty easily when bumped or jostled.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Super cute, but much smaller than advertised
reviews.reviewText: My (almost) 2 year old played with this for half an hour straight, which is probably a record. It's such a cute set. I took away and stored the smallest pieces because she still likes to put toys in her mouth.Note- the base is *WAY* smaller than advertised. It is just big enough for one single circle (as shown in my photo).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Just right size and amount for small child

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Creative feminine Lego-type set
reviews.reviewText: 19 mo granddaughter enjoys playing with these. Plastic pieces fit easily into each other to make stackable flowers. Not super sturdy but hopefully will last a while.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Fun but fits a bit wonky
reviews.reviewText: My little one loves this set but when she stacks the parts they’re so loose they don’t stay when she lifts the flower creations to show me. If the fit was a bit more Lego like I think this would be a perfect item for kids big and small
